reviewText:
It's an anomaly these days for a game to reel in such an emotional response in the player only to pull a bait-and-switch when you least expect it. I was kept at the edge of my boat seat from the moment the SEGA logo lured me in, I was ready. My heart was on the line along with the monster bass that swallowed my jig whole as he failed under the dock as guitars seemingly from heaven itself pounded away as did the giant fish.

I turned rod left
IT'S COMING NEAR
I turned rod right
COME ON ALMOST THERE

In a brief moment of glory the monsterous bass was lifted on to my boat, seemingly putting it on the edge of capsizing.

THIS ONE'S HUUUUUUUGE!

I ranked in my tears and felt the bonus of time rush over me.
Thank you Sega, thank you.

reviewText: Game is not that bad, but the analog controls using the right thumbstick on the XBOX 360 Controller seem a bit odd when trying to simulate the feel of turning the crank on the fishing line to reel in the fish . Kind of short and lacking in content but its still not that bad.\n\nStill prefer Fishermans Bait on PS1 if you have the console and have access to the game :)

reviewText:
This game really caught my attention.  A fishing game that no others can match on the comparison scale.

The gameplay offered by SEGA Bass fishing has serious buoyancy, and you will not mind sinking hours into it.  I had one hull of a great time learning all the mechanics inside it.  I really wish there were morray like it.

The amount of time I lost just getting so in-depth with this game was a bit crappie, but maybe my time control is just a fluke; and there really is no need to be steamed about that.  And I just failed to keep my head above water.

I recommend you try this game, don't leave it up to salmon else.  This game will seriously have you hooked.
voteText: 28 of 36 people (78%) found this review helpful 19 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Games like this are what make SEGA arcade KINGS!

Take a niche concept to begin with (fishing), narrow it down to a ridiculous level (Bass only) and then polish every bit of gameplay, sound and presentation until it shines like a new ferrari and is more addictive than crack.

For people who enjoy fishing in real life, this game is pure bliss. And even if you're not into fishing but still love other arcade classics from the turn of the century, this one stands proud among them.

reviewText:
Better fish AI than in CoD Ghost!

Never owned the full game on the Dreamcast, but had the demo. I played that demo for hours. Now i finally got a chance to play the full game and it didn't disappoint.

Currently frustrated with the tournament mode. I do very well in the lodge area, but the bridge is brutal. The water in the bridge area is very deep, so you have to use sinking lures, if you don't reel the lure will just go to the bottom, if you lure fast the fish won't bite. This makes it very hard to catch anything in this area and just ends up costing me the tournament.  So be prepared to rage and scream at some stupid virtual fish to bite your f#%&ing lure!

reviewerDisplayName: J I N X Y B O I
reviewText:
That game you like? Yes, that one. The one that you sorted into favorites in your steam library. It's terrible and objectively so.

Okay, that game's actually subjectively terrible, but only in the light of SEGA Bass Fishing™. SEGA Bass Fishing™ has lore so deep and replayability so seemless that I am literally dumbfounded by the now gleaming short comings of every other game ever created.

Like Atari games of old, anything played after SEGA Bass Fishing™ will now appear as a waste of time and a thing of the past. Which was wasted. Because like, it was time you spent playing something other than  SEGA Bass Fishing™.

reviewText:
Classic Sega game.  But it's instantly clear that this game was made for arcades.
The timer adds a little challenge but since you can continue your game with the press of a button after the timer has run out there's no point in having it there to begin with. They should've removed it completely, or should've made a different mode for it for those people who do actually enjoy it.. Then again, console ports weren't treated the same as they are treated these days so I willjust forgive them ;)
And besides, the port isn't really all that poor, it still holds up but the control scheme is also classic Sega and makes absolutely no sense. But, it's playable with a little practice.
If you're a fishing fan, you basically have no other choice. There aren't that many fishing games out there. But Sega Bass Fishing would be a solid choice.

reviewText: Man this game brings me back to the days when I was a kid and the entramce to walmart was a cool place to check out! This game is just clean fun looks the same as it did and how it should considering its a game from the 90s I play on a game pad and the controls are easy but the game still has enough of a challenge to make you want to play it though it can and does get boring after a while I would say it would be a fun game to play for you and a younger kid even if you don't really like fishing this game is still enjoyable.

reviewText: A wonderful fishing game that really brings you back to the Dreamcast system. The controls are the only obstacle of this game. The gameplay is awesome because you can catch a fish every-time casting out. It has a single player campaign that lets you catch alot of fish for the Tournament standings. There are really big fish and little ones to be caught but all will be a challenge if you dont know how to handle the reel right. The graphics are great for this type of game. It puts you in control of everything and lets you see into the water to catch the fish you want. The music in game is old school and fun. The overall game is great and if your into fishing this is a must buy when seeing it on sale. Ive loved playing it in my spare time and I know you will too.

reviewText:
good fishing simulation game, but this an old game, if you love complex fishing, don't pick this one. the old reel fishing and fisherman's bait on PS1 is still better
the game just about
> select lure, select tackle point, and reel
> u get fish, then only 2 option fish or miss,
> turn down , turn left, turn right, reel and hold
> after that they measure your fish
> and repeat

all modes different only in time of playing
> arcade mode, play with limited time
> original mode, (or i can say) championship mode/career mode total 15-20 minutes per stages  and you can get sonic lure from here LOL
> practice, yeh practice, try some lures and different places

I'm not recommended this game because, it's really simple game-and repeatable, but I admit the game still good as port from old dreamcast.

reviewText:
A ten year old trolling simulator.

Playing this game is on the same level as a madden game from a decade ago. It does nothing unique and kind of feels pointless, I can only recommend this game to the very small number of people who regard this game in high nostalgic esteem.

Fishing is a minigame and should be an aside for games like Breath of Fire 4 or Sonic Adventure, the latter of which is a magnificent example of a game from that time period that still holds up.

reviewText: A great Dreamcast classic ported over nicely to PC. It probably won't take very long to complete, especially given that Arcade mode gives you infinite credits, but let's face it - most of your time on here will be spent trying to catch the biggest fish you can find. And even then it's a pretty relaxing game that can kill a few minutes if you don't have much time to spare. Loved it on Dreamcast, love it on here too.\n\nThis one's huge!" indeed."

reviewText:
Boring.   The only way SEGA could find to sell this was to stick it in a Dreamcast bundle of some great Dreamcast Titles.

If I got this back when I was a child, it would be worse than being grounded without videogames.   I would rather be grounded than to play this.  I would rather read a book or do chores than play this game.  (Currently torturing myself for achievements....)


PROS:
Acceptable Metal music when you catch a fish.
Hearing the fisherman/fisherwoman yell FISH or FEESH!
Nice fish models

CONS:
No tutorial
Unreadable Fish AI
TIME LIMITS!!!!!!
Bland human models
Unable to choose how far you cast
Unable to choose to cast anywhere that is not in front of you
Unable to travel
Areas that seem to have no fish at all
Rough tournament scores to beat

In this bundle, I'd rather play Crazy Taxi or Sonic Adventure DX.

reviewText:
I seem to remember fishing not being this dull.
There is absolutely nothing going on in this game:
1. Select lure
2. Select place to throw lure
3. Reel it in
4. Hope a fish will catch the lure and make sure your line doesn't break

At least the announcer sounds like a bad imitation of an overzealous George Takei, so there's that.

reviewText:
Could be one of the worst games ever.  There is no way to adjust the sound or mute the hokey Japanese accent voice over.  There are limited things which you can do.  These include: turn your rod left, turn your rod right, reel in slow, reel in normal, reel in fast, and of course, cast.  Maps are limited to four different areas on the same lake.  You can choose from a very limited number of lures; six to start with, a handful more later (which are simply different paint jobs on the originals), and as far as I can determine, you only have one rod to choose from.

Oh yes, and you can also determine which time of day you want to go fishing: morning, noon, or evening.  The time of day seems to make very little difference as far as I can tell.

This game would be far to expensive if it were free, but the $8.95 which this game costs is the equivalent of being skinned and gutted alive.  It's not even humane enough for a fish.  The only positive thing about this game is that your hands don't get stinky.  But SEGA sure stink up the place by charging money for this game.

reviewText: Suit up for combat in exoskeletons that evolve every aspect of a soldier's battle readiness, enabling combatants to deploy with an advanced lethality and eliminating the need for specialization. Players experience enhanced player movement and verticality through boost jumps and grappling, covert cloaking abilities, and biomechanics that provide unparalleled strength, awareness, endurance, and speed. With the advent of the exoskeleton and newly advanced armor and weaponry, every soldier commands tactical freedom in any terrain unlike ever before, fundamentally changing the way gamers play SEGA Bass Fishing across all modes.

reviewText:
Having originally played this game on the Dreamcast, I can safely say it is a faithful port and is just as engaging. This game can be mildly addictive due to driving the player to want to do better.  Arcade mode is easy to clear, but the Tornament Series and bonus lures add to the replay value, as do the extra locations in practice mode.

Keyboard controls are absolutely fine, once you remember what each button does. They cannot be altered, but are comfortable enough to master, so they may not need to be.  No crashing or issues with saving yet.

Only downside: imperial measurements cannot be altred to display in metric; get with the times, developers!

All in all, recommended, especially for players who like a challenge and who strive to do better. This is coming from someone who until now, has not taken an interest in real-life angling. Worth the discounted £2.79!

reviewText:
As a long time non-fisherman guy, i have wondered about the mystery of fishing. How does one simply catch a fish? Why does the fish always swim away? Why does my rod always get tangled?

Deep questions need deep answers, and this game answers them all. Now i can fish, and the fish can fish too. Now whenever i go fishing, i always bring my rod along.

As archangel Gabriel said to me in a dream, the first step to elightenment is knowing how to fish". I took that literally and i'm now a sea bass. Thanks Sega."
